text:
Park Row, north from Mail Street (on the left), to the Brooklyn Bridge. A portion of Nassau Street, is observed on the far side of triangular plot, with the statue of Benjamin Franklin thereon. This section of the City just east of City Hall Park, is known as Printing House Square, as at this date, the newspaper publication of the City was centered here.

About 1880.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Mail Street

text:
A general view southward from Duane Street, between Park Row and Centre Street, and showing the City Hall Zone, when it was known as Printing House Square. This view is slightly further westward than No. 1, and also shows Broadway on the farther side of City Hall Park. On the right appears the new Hall of Records (under construction) with the City Hall Building just beyond. Note demolition of the Fire Engine Co. No. 7, Hook and Ladder No. 1, which stood at the northeasterly corner of City Hall Park.

About 1902.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Manhattan: Duane Street - Park Row

text:
City Hall Park: A view southeastward from Broadway and showing the rear of the City Hall. The buildings on the far side of the park, form what is known as "Printing House Square", of which the Tribune Tower predominates. Shown on the left, is a portion of the Court House.

Summer 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A similar view, and showing the dome of the Pulitzer (New York World) Building.

June 4, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a broader view.

June 4, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: City Hall Park - City Hall; New York County Court House; New York Tribune; Pulitzer Building; "Printing House Square".
